content: this loop will be on the very front of the stitch work your hdcvflo stitches in this very front third loop only i recommend placing your hook through this loop from bottom to top see the visual representation below this technique can take a little bit of getting used to but once you re in the swing of things making the beanie i find that it moves quickly and creates a beautiful effect page 2 maddy lou crochet the calli beanie pattern instructions for the adult version using thick and quick i chained 31 and it measured 16 inches this can be customized - make your chain long enough so that it goes from your brow bone to the point on the top of the head where you want the top to be plus roughly 4 inches for the fold over brim row 1 skip first chain and work 1 half_double_crochet into each of the next chains ch1 and turn to set up the next row row 2 - x skip chain and work 1 hdcvflo into each of the next stitches until 1 stitch remains 1 regular half_double_crochet in the last stitch of the row ch1 and turn to set up the next row continue repeating row 2 until you form a rectangle that is wide enough to wrap around the head you re making the beanie for keep in mind that it will stretch slightly and that you should end with an even total number of row seaming fold your work in half so that your starting chain row and your final row are touching and the chain row is closer to you slip_stitch to connect each chain to the very front loop of each corresponding stitch across from it do this all the way across until you ve formed a long tube cut your yarn leaving a 15 inch tail cinching weave your yarn tail in and out of your row which will now be vertical i recommend doing two row at a time - so pull your yarn through to the back of one row skip a row then pull your yarn through to the front of the next tow complete this all the way around and pull your yarn tight to cinch note that at this point the inside of the beanie is facing out finishing once the top of the beanie is cinched you can really see it taking shape there are just a few more steps continue weaving your yarn tail through the top ridges that have been form to close any gaps and make sure the top is really cinched tight i recommend doing this in a star pattern use what remains of your yarn tail to attach an optional pom or simply weave it in with your other end finally turn the beanie right-side-out and fold over the bottom to create the brim that s it thank you so much for downloading the calli beanie pattern and supporting maddy lou crochet
